comment.body:
Hi there,

Please leave a detailed description/recreation steps if this is an issue to reopen this.

issue.title: Email adress with quoted local part has quotes truncated
issue.body:
Example of an email address which is valid according to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Email_address#:~:text=example.org.-,Examples,-%5Bedit%5D

`From: "john.no.doe."@doe.no.jp`

`AddressHeader->getEmail()` returns `john.no.doe.@doe.no.jp` which is invalid as quotes are missing.

comment.body:
That's a very good point.  Thanks for that :)

Fix will come soon.

issue.title: Decoding base64 body
issue.body:
Hi, Zaahid! Hope for your advice.

We receive non-standard emails from the same sender.
[mail_example.txt](https://github.com/zbateson/mail-mime-parser/files/9937256/mail_example.txt) as example (Some data has been removed, but this does not affect the main problem).
Email with headers:
```
Content-Type: multipart/mixed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
```
The sender uses SAP Web Application Server 7.00, which encodes the entire body of the message in base64 encoding.
According to RFC [1521](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1521#section-5) such email is not valid
`If a Content-Transfer-Encoding header field appears as part of a message header, it applies to the entire body of that message. If a Content-Transfer-Encoding header field appears as part of a body part's headers, it applies only to the body of that body part. If an entity is of type "multipart" or "message", the Content-Transfer-Encoding is not permitted to have any value other than a bit width (e.g., "7bit", "8bit", etc.) or "binary`

As a workaround, we now use this construction
```
before check multipart/mixed and base64 and entire body is encoded in base64
$message = $zBatesonMimeParser->parse($nonStandardMail, false);
$message->removeHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding");
$message->addRawHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding", "binary");
$message->setContent(base64_decode($message->getContent()));
$message2 = $zBatesonMimeParser->parse($message->getStream(), false);
```
Perhaps there are better ways to do this?

Thank you for your attention.

issue.title: Can't get inline image from Gmail API
issue.body:
Hello,

`<?php
// ...
$mime = ZBateson\MailMimeParser\Message::from(Base64Url::decode($mail->getRaw()));
echo $mime->getHtmlContent();`

I'm getting the right mail, with HTML like i want, but images sources are replaced by : `cid:image.png`.
I understand that they put images in attachments, but can't get a way to make it work.

comment.body:
Hi @didi1357 --

Thanks for that -- I'm sure people will find it helpful searching like you have :)

Beyond scope meaning I don't think it belong in the library.  It's certainly adjacent and very close, but not related to the actual parsing and reading of email content.  I could see it be desirable to an 'email client' that uses an email parser to read emails _and also displays_ the email to an end user, but there could be many 'very close' things (like maybe finding the 'reply' portion of an email, stripping out the rest) that aren't strictly 'parsing' and should be in separate libraries.

All the best and thanks again!

issue.title: A very belated bug report
issue.body:
Hi Zaahid,

I hope you're well, where ever you are at the moment. 

I have a very belated bug report for version 2+ of the library. A week ago I updated my last module to version 2.2.3 (the most recent version) and we got mysterious issues with AWS refusing to process our emails due too the email size being larger than 40Mb (their upper limit). When looking at the emails they were all well below < 40 Mb. So a conundrum! After adding logging at several places it became apparent that the mailmimeparser was increasing the size of the emails by a factor of 3. I've been able to pinpoint this behaviour to the function setAsMultipartSigned. I've included a small movie with the logging output. You can see that the email is 20MB when read into mailmimeparser and as soon as I call setAsMultipartSigned it balloons the email size to 63 MB. Don't know why, don't know how :-)

[screen-capture (15).webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/461034/197528787-b37b9c52-9c64-4a6f-9edb-4968727907b8.webm)

Kind regards
Meint

comment.body:
Hi Meint,

Nice to hear from you :)

Interesting issue you're encountering... I had a quick look with a 4.7MB test file (from the MMP test suite: m3005.txt), and calling 'setAsMultipartSigned' and 'save()' on the message, I'm getting a 4.7MB output file with signed parts.

I then used my largest example attachment, attaching it 3 more times to m3005.txt and creating a new email that's 18.7MB, and did the same thing -- the output is also 18.7MB.

Is that your path too?  Basically calling setAsMultipartSigned and then save() on it?  Are you also adding the signature at this point maybe with setSignature?

Lastly, is the original message a mime message with an attachment that's base64 encoded?  Anything else interesting about the message?

This is my full test code:

```php
$message = Message::from(Psr7\Utils::streamFor(fopen('m3005.txt', 'r')), true);
$message->setAsMultipartSigned('tst', 'tst');
$message->save('output-message.txt');
```

Feel free to email me as well if there's something to add privately that you don't want added here.

All the best :)
Zaahid

issue.title: Fix PHP 8.1 return type deprecation notices
issue.body:
Still missing in HeaderStream.

Got following message in our unit testing code:
```
PHP Deprecated:  Return type of ZBateson\MailMimeParser\Stream\HeaderStream::update(SplSubject $subject) should either be compatible with SplObserver::update(SplSubject $subject): void, or the #[\ReturnTypeWillChange] attribute should be used to temporarily suppress the notice in /home/runner/work/mobilityshop-api/mobilityshop-api/vendor/zbateson/mail-mime-parser/src/Stream/HeaderStream.php on line 51
```
